xmlMandatorySingleRootNode.description: This is a fake object node for the DataModelDesigner to draw the object hierarchy properly. It will not be inserted into the data model. The Short Object Name must be FakeParentObject.
This object is a root of all objects defined by ITU_T_ORG.
This object is a root of all MIB objects defined in T-REC-G.988.
This object is a root of all MIB objects defined under the Equipment management section in T-REC-G.988.
(R, W, Set-by-create (if applicable)) (mandatory for configurable circuit packs) (1 byte).
(R) (mandatory for circuit packs that provide a traffic scheduler function) (1 byte).
(R) (mandatory for circuit packs that provide a traffic scheduler function) (1 byte).
(R) (mandatory for circuit packs that provide a traffic scheduler function) (1 byte).
This object is a root of all MIB objects defined under the ANI management section in T-REC-G.988.
This object is a root of all MIB objects defined under the Traffic Management section in T-REC-G.988.
This object is a root of all MIB objects defined under the Layer 2 data services section in T-REC-G.988.

This proprietary object organizes data associated with MacBridgeServiceProfileObject ME. Instances of this object are created and deleted automatically when their associated MacBridgeServiceProfileObject ME are created or deleted.
Name of the bridge that is created to forward data corresponding to the information of its associated MacBridgeServiceProfileObject.

This proprietary object organizes data associated with MapperServiceProfileObject managed entity (ME). Instances of this object are created and deleted automatically when their associated MapperServiceProfileObject ME are created or deleted.
Name of the bridge that is created to forward data corresponding to the information of its associated MapperServiceProfileObject.
Received frame VLAN tagging operation table.
This attribute identifies the CMS object class ID for each instance of this managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute is the ONU's best effort estimate of the actual bandwidth currently being delivered over all dynamic multicast groups. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
This attribute counts the number of times the corresponding subscriber sent a join message that was accepted. When full, the counter rolls over to 0. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).

This attribute counts the number of join messages that did, or would have, exceeded the max multicast bandwidth, whether accepted or denied. When full, the counter rolls over to 0. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
This attribute counts the number of customers that currently subscribe to this UNI object. When full, the counter rolls over to 0. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
This attribute identifies the IGMP version. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
This object lists the information of current subscriber that has been joined to this UNI port.
This attribute identifies the TCI including priority, CFI, and vlan ID of subscriber. Its value should be 0 if not used.(R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute identifies the source (server) IP address of subscriber. Its value should be 0 if not used. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
This attribute identifies the mulitcast group IP address of subscriber. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
This attribute identifies the client (Set top box) IP address of subscriber. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
This attribute identifies the last time that subscribe has sent the join or re-join message. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
This object is a root of all MIB objects defined under the Layer 3 data services section in T-REC-G.988.

This proprietary object organizes data associated with IP Host Config Data managed entity (ME). Instances of this object are created and deleted automatically when their associated IP Host Config Data ME are created or deleted.
Current status of the connection. Enumeration of: 0-Unconfigured,1-Connecting,2-Connected,3-PendingDisconnect,4-Disconneting,5-Disconnected
If this is a dynamic connection, then we will start a dhcpc to get the IP address for this connection. The pid of the dhcpc is stored in this field. A pid of 0 indicates that no dhcpc is running.

This proprietary object organizes data associated with IPv6 Host Config Data managed entity (ME). Instances of this object are created and deleted automatically when their associated IPv6 Host Config Data ME are created or deleted.
Current status of the connection. Enumeration of: 0-Unconfigured,1-Connecting,2-Connected,3-PendingDisconnect,4-Disconneting,5-Disconnected
If this is a dynamic connection, then we will start a dhcpc to get the IP address for this connection. The pid of the dhcpc is stored in this field. A pid of 0 indicates that no dhcpc is running.
M flag information from router advertisement
O flag information from router advertisement
This object is a root of all MIB objects defined under the Ethernet services section in T-REC-G.988.
(R) (mandatory if the ONU supports circuit packs with configurable interface types, e.g., 10/100 BaseT card) (1 byte).
(R, W) (mandatory for interfaces with auto detection options) (1 byte).
This object is a root of all MIB objects defined under the Voice services section in T-REC-G.988.
This object is a root of all MIB objects defined under the Moca services section in T-REC-G.988.
This object contains additional Moca configuration objects that are not present in the standard X_ITU_T G.988 Moca object.

This 2-byte number is directly associated with the physical position of the UNI. The first byte is the slot ID (defined in clause 9.1.5/G.988). The second byte is the port ID, with range 1..255. (R) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
Setting the MoCA behaviour during Network Admission. 0-AutoNegotiate for NC, 1-Always NC, 2-Never NC.
Enable MoCA for automatic network search, using the LOF and FREQ_MASK parameters. When FALSE, MoCA uses only the LOF value to join the network.

Transmit Power Control setting. When TRUE, the transmit power level is adjusted to a setting that will achieve the Max target PHY bit rate. The adjusted power setting will be less than or equal to Tx power. When FALSE, the transmit power level is set to <Tx Power>.
Ability to transmit in a constant power mode as defined by the spec. It is used only for lab testing. Tx channel will be LOF. 0-Normal Operation, 1-Tx Mode, 2-Rx Mode, 3-External Control.

Setting the MoCA node operation for data traffic for Multicast traffic. 0 - Normal mode, 1-MCast Bcast Mode. Normal mode is when we have a host with IGMP snooping ability. For CTP testing, the BC mode should be used.
Turning on the lab mode will enable SNR/IQ graphs in BBS. This mode limits the network to 8 nodes.
A special BRCM mode that allows classification according to side band QTAG field, instead of VLAN PRIO. 0-Standard, 1-QTAG classification.
Max transmit time in micro secs. Max tx time allowed to transmit a frame through the MoCA physical interface. Used for limitng aggregation.
Max Tx Power Level allowed in dBm units. Range:-27-3, default is 3dBM.
Units in terms of 0.5 dBs. So, 3 dB of SNR margin will have a value of 6 here.
A request for an Out-Of-Order LMO to any node.
Control setting to turn on/off LMO reporting.
RF channel number of the lowest frequency channel covered by the Taboo Channel Mask field. 32 is the lowest value allowed for this field, corresponding to 800 Mhz center frequency.

Ability to change Taboo Frequency Mask. MSB corresponds to the lowest Taboo channel as identified in the TABOO_MASK_START field. Each consecutive bit then corresponds to channels offset by multiples of 25 Mhz. A bit in the Taboo_Channel_Mask field is set to '1' if the corresponding channel is taboo. Only the 24 msb is relevant. i.e., 0xHHHHHH00, where H represents any Hex number.
Operation mode for the CTP (certification test plan) of inserting IE in every RR.
Operation mode for the Certification Test Plan of inserting 8 IEs in every MAP.
Maximum allowed packets for aggregated transmissions.
Set Max Constellation on all carriers in the receive from a specified node. Value 16 indicates ALL NODES.
Preferred NC nodes have a preference over the other nodes in the MoCA Network to become the NC node.
PMK interval time. This configuration will take effect only after the next key change. It is in hrs.
TEK intervals time. This configuration will take effect only after the next key change. It is in terms of minutes.
This object contains additional moca status items not present in the ITU-T G.988 spec.

This 2-byte number is directly associated with the physical position of the UNI. The first byte is the slot ID (defined in clause 9.1.5/G.988). The second byte is the port ID, with range 1..255. (R) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
Need some description. Would this be better as a short string?
This is the simple stats object associated with a Moca device. There is one stats object per Moca device in the system.

This 2-byte number is directly associated with the physical position of the UNI. The first byte is the slot ID (defined in clause 9.1.5/G.988). The second byte is the port ID, with range 1..255. (R) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This object is a root of all MIB objects defined under the General purpose MEs section in T-REC-G.988.
(R) (mandatory) (2N bytes, where N is the number of entries in the list.).
(R) (mandatory) (M bytes, where M is the number of entries in the list.).
This object is a root of all MIB objects defined in Miscellaneous Services section in T-REC-G.988.
This attribute is defined only in ITU-T G.987 systems. It contains the broadcast key generated by the OLT. It is a table. (R, W) (optional).
This object is a root of vendor-specific debug objects.
This object holds the configurable system information of the OMCI Stack.
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the first TCONT managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
Maximum number of TCONT in the ONU. (R, W) (mandatory) (1 bytes).
The 32-bit bitmask that represents policies for 32 TCont. If bit is 0 then policy is strict priority (SP), otherwise policy is weighted round robin (WRR). (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the first Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the second Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the third Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the fourth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the fifth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the sixth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the seventh Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the eighth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the ningth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the tenth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the eleventh Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the twelvth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the thirteenth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the fourteenth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the fifteenth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the sixteenth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the seventeenth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the eighteenth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the nineteenth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the twentieth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the twenty-first Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the twenty-second Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the twenty-third Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the twenty-fourth Ethernet managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
Maximum number of Ethernet in the ONU. (R, W) (mandatory) (1 bytes).
The bit mask specifies which Ethernet port is member of RG bridge only, or ONT bridge only, or both RG and ONT bridges. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
Run PPTP UNI_0 as VEIP. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the first MoCA managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the second MoCA managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
Maximum number of MoCA in the ONU. (R, W) (mandatory) (1 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the first POTS managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the second POTS managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
Maximum number of POTS in the ONU. (R, W) (mandatory) (1 bytes).
This attribute uniquely identifies instance of the first Virtual Ethernet Interface Point (VEIP) managed entity. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
Maximum number of Virtual Ethernet Interface Point (VEIP) in the ONU. (R, W) (mandatory) (1 bytes).
Maximum number of MoCA in the ONU. (R, W) (mandatory) (1 bytes).
The debug flags contains enable/disable information to specify which modules should display debug messages. (R, W) (mandatory) (4 bytes).
The promisc mode that OMCI uses to configure the ONU. These modes are: 0 - off, 1 - on. (R, W) (mandatory) (1 bytes).
The mode that OMCI uses to get performance monitoring counters. These modes are: 0 - 15 minutes, 1 - current. (R, W) (mandatory) (1 bytes).
The true value indicates OMCI raw messages are accepted by HTTPD, otherwise OMCI raw messages are discarded by HTTPD.
Indicates the configuration is GPON RG FULL.
Indicates the configuration is GPON ONU.
This attribute identifies the traffic management option defined in ONU-G ME. (R, W) (mandatory) (1 byte).
This attribute selects the voice provisioning model in G.988, OMCI path (0), or IP path (1). (R, W) (mandatory) (1 byte).
This attribute identifies the OMCI application type, (0)G.984, (1)G.987. (R, W) (mandatory) (2 bytes).
This attribute identifies the QoS action when the downtream priority queue in GemPortNetworkCtp ME is unknown. (R, W) (mandatory) (1 byte).
Indicates join request forwarding option. False - based on OMCI "unauthorized join request behaviour" attribute, True - override and force forwarding.
Configures the forwarding of frames with reserved destination MAC addresses.

An experimental flag, it defines how the ONU looks up the OMCI MIB to find the valid ANI-UNI paths. False - check the whole OMCI MIB, True - check the UNI ports that MEs on their ANI-UNI path have been updated.
Defines whether or not to configure VLANCtl rules for the three autonomously predefined forwarding entries in Extended VLAN ME.
This object holds the statistics counters of the OMCI Stack.
Total number of received baseline packets.
Total number of received Extended packets.
Total number of length errors in received packets.
Total number of CRC errors in received packets.
Total number of errors other than length and CRC in received packets.
Total number of Attribute Value Change packets transmitted.
Total number of alarm packets transmitted.
Total number of Response packets transmitted.
